snippet: A Hong Kong series has tapped into the tensions between the city's residents and mainland Chinese visitors, striking a nerve on both sides of the border and drawing the attention of Chinese censors.
abstract: Hong Kong television series Inbound Troubles taps into tensions between residents and mainland Chinese visitors, whose rising influence is blamed for a number of civic problems.

byline.contributor: Chris Buckley and Calvin Yang contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: A Hong Kong series has tapped into the tensions between the city's residents and mainland Chinese visitors, striking a nerve on both sides of the border and drawing the attention of Chinese censors.

headline.main: Hong Kong TV Drama Plays Out Uneasy Ties With China
headline.print_headline: Hong Kong TV Show Plays on Uneasy Ties With China
